lenders.name: Heidi
lenders.loan_because: I want to pay it forward

lenders.name: Julio Macias
lenders.loan_because: People from third world countries need credit just like we need credit in developed countries. A few dollars have a major impact on their business ventures. Local big banks only service lower risk ventures as in the US. Big banks are part the problem, we at kiva are part of the solution.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm an immigrant from Bolivia and now naturalized US Citizen working here for the past 27 years. I own a wireless retail store. We sell cell phones, satellite equipment and accessories. For more information please visit our website and click below.

lenders.name: Ram
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference.

lenders.name: Victor
lenders.loan_because: I believe that everyone should get access to financing for their projects

lenders.name: Larissa

lenders.occupational_info: Doctor

lenders.name: Kelly

lenders.occupational_info: Helping people become better after illness.  I help them regain strength, endurance, walking...so they can live with a better quality of life.

lenders.name: Julie & Joe

lenders.occupational_info: I work in the banking industry.

lenders.name: Deborah
lenders.loan_because: Gof is good to me and I would like to share my blessings with others who only need a helping hand to better themselves.

lenders.name: Taryn

lenders.name: Cole Papers, Inc.
lenders.occupational_info: We are a family owned company, founded in 1918. We sell & distribute janitorial supplies, paper supplies, fine printing paper, hotel amenities, and have a wholesale flooring division. We operate 8 branch offices and one corporate headquarters. We employ 170 people in 3 states.

lenders.occupational_info: Protect the environment, Stop poverty even if our government can't.  Do everything in your life time to help someone. No one can judge you because you can't, but make an effort

lenders.name: Karlo
lenders.loan_because: I can afford to.

lenders.name: Ty Ovendale

lenders.occupational_info: I'm a software developer working in Seattle.  I also like to drink beer and play the bass.

lenders.name: Christopher

lenders.name: Nanette

lenders.occupational_info: I design and write custom financial software.

lenders.name: Sarah
lenders.loan_because: I believe in empowering other people to make change in their own lives rather than imposing my views on others or simply handing out an unsustainable material gift.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a venture philanthropy nonprofit organization that funds proven  nonprofit models to replicate in Boston.

lenders.name: Hendra&Nessy&Harira&Raja

lenders.occupational_info: Hendra works in financial sector. His dream: to be a writer some day, or a teacher for small kids. Nessy left her job in 2007 due to pregnancy and now stays home taking care of Harira (see how cute she is as shown in the profile picture). (Edit 2012: New addition to our family: Raja

lenders.occupational_info: What I want you to know about me is that I'm a mom, wife, daughter, sister, and friend.  The 'job' that makes me smile the most is my kids.  Two boys - 17 yr old and 12 yr old.  They are my heart. My husband is my best friend. Married for 18 years. I am 46 years 'young'.  I can't wait to track the success of my FIRST Kiva loan with these fabulous women!!

lenders.loan_because: We are all one nation under God.  We are all indivisible.

lenders.name: Givearn
lenders.loan_because: We at Givearn.com figured out a way to make others better off without making anyone worse off. Now that's what we call efficient!

lenders.name: Joseph
lenders.loan_because: I'm blessed to be living in what is arguably the greatest country in the world and would like to be able to share in the driving spirit of those who aren't in as beneficial a place as I am yet continue striving to do their best under conditions which are oftentimes difficult to even imagine.
lenders.occupational_info: Computer Repair

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: Kiva.org lets us give a hand up and not a hand out.
lenders.occupational_info: Internet entrepreneur

lenders.occupational_info: Our two classes have been involved in raising money through bottle drives and other means to make a difference on a global scale.  We believe in the power of Random Acts of Kindness and want to improve the world in any way we can.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: the dreams of those who sleep upon feathers are not more beautiful than the dreams of those who sleep upon the earth.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the most dynamic and fastest growing place the world has ever seen, I try every day to keep up with advances and stay afloat whilst making the place faster and more exciting to those who come see it. My world is the internet, my toolbox is LAMP and my job is to help make my world more amazing. BTW, I believe communication is key to toppling corruption...Kiva is a part of this.

lenders.occupational_info: i am a mom and wife trying to raise consciencious healthy kids

lenders.occupational_info: Right now I teach students in the 3rd and 4th grade (ages 8-10 yrs. old).

lenders.name: Lawrence
lenders.loan_because: If you give someone a fish you feed them for a meal.  Teach them to fish and feed them for a lifetime.
lenders.occupational_info: As and entrepreneur and c.f.o. for my sons struggling construction business I know how scarry it can get. If we don't make it I hope someone out there does.

lenders.name: Richard
lenders.loan_because: I believe we can all help one another out. By making a small loan through Kiva, I can be part of something bigger than myself.

lenders.occupational_info: I manage the production, marketing and product development for a line of industrial valves...

lenders.name: Hanno
lenders.loan_because: I think people need to help each other out, and that it can be used to show God's love for every person on this planet.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a Java software engineer.

lenders.name: Terri Nakamura
lenders.loan_because: 33 years ago a bank made a loan to my small business. Since then I've done well so it's great to be able to help someone else now.
lenders.occupational_info: I create corporate identities and develop branding and design annual reports, brochures, web sites, magazines, product packaging and just about anything that visually communicates.

lenders.name: Online-Marketing-Agentur
lenders.loan_because: It makes sense.
lenders.occupational_info:
http://www.spurtig.de
http://www.hsdpa-flatrate.de
http://www.funkster.de
http://www.mobil-telefonieren.de
http://www.rslcom.de

lenders.name: Dawn
lenders.loan_because: I'd like to help in some small way.

lenders.name: Martin James Peake
lenders.loan_because: Support others

lenders.name: Andrea
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others not as fortunate as us Canadians.  Those who have the same work ethic, passion for life, and want to make something of themselves and their communities, they truly deserve my help.
lenders.occupational_info:
Inmates in Canada get 3 square meals a day, endless TV and movies, a clean warm bed to sleep in...yet they still complain relentlessly about being so hard done by!  They will never know the true hardship or struggle like those who live in a 3rd world country.   

Every time I donate, I feel I am correcting some bad karma.

lenders.name: Anastasia
lenders.loan_because:
Being a Russian whose youth happened to be in the time of the collapse of the Soviet Union and of the resulting virtual demolition of the Russian economy, with people having no jobs, no money, no food and nowhere to turn to; having grown up through a lot of hardship - I was fortunate enough to get out of this unhappiness and poverty.
I want to help talented people around the world not to miss their chance in life. I always planned to start donating "somewhere in future" but justified not doing so with not making enough money yet. Kiva is a great tool to make something real right here right now, to trust through the traceability of each loan, to feel involved through progress reports, to be a part of the global team of people doing the same good thing.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for Shell on international assignments, now in Norway. My idea is that driving economic progress is the foundation for the individual life improvement - poor people sruggle through life for food and basic needs but this is not and should not be the purpose of life. Multinational oil companies, no matter how rich they are blamed to be, stimulate economic growth in the countries they develop projects in- through brining technology, resources, market experience, money - the rest is up to the local goverments tfor channelling all those resources into the local development.

lenders.name: Amy
lenders.loan_because: I was given a certificate to loan for my birthday.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student.

lenders.name: Laura
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people out who are less fortunate than myself. I was blessed to be born into a rich nation. While I did not grow up with a lot of money or status myself, I am now at a point where I am comfortable. I want to make that dream a reality for other people as well.
lenders.occupational_info: I schedule resources, manage budgets, and track activities towards completion for small scale and large scale HR projects!

lenders.name: Amy
lenders.loan_because: I believe that all people should have an opportunity to lead a happy and fulfilled life.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach classes about critical thinking, society, and technology at a small college.

"Beware lest you say in your heart, 'My power and the might of my hand have gotten me this wealth.'   You shall remember the LORD your God, for it is he who gives you power to get wealth"  
Deuteronomy 8:17-18

lenders.name: Rebecca
lenders.loan_because: Firstly, it is important to work to improve the lives of others in whatever way we can.  Second, loaning gives individuals the opportunity to earn a continuous stream of income, so they can continually support themselves through time versus accepting a "handout."  I believe this fosters independence versus dependence, which is important.  Donations go further this way, and you are helping more people.

lenders.loan_because: I believe in helping people help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I work on an airplane called the Global Hawk.  It is a very complex airplane that flies without a pilot.  It flies very high (60,000 ft) and takes pictures with special cameras that can see at night and can detect heat.  The US government uses it in Iraq.  There are no weapons onboard.  In the 2007 wildfires in southern California it was used to take pictures of the fires (the cameras can see through smoke).  These pictures were used to help the firefighters track the progress of the fires and help people who needed to be evacuated.

lenders.name: AMIRALI
lenders.loan_because:
Since I have been in the same situation previously, I fully understand the desires and hopes of these individuals as entrepreneurs to fulfill their aspirations, ambitions and achieve their vision to grow in this world like anybody else and be proud of it.

My mentor always preached that: All men, rich and poor, must aid one another materially and personally.
This fraternity is absolute, and it comprises men of any color or creed.
All men irrespective of their color or creed are the sons of Adam in the flesh
and all carry in them spark of the Divine Light.

Everyone should strive his best to see that this spark be not extinguished
but rather developed to the full Companionship-on-High.

One should, by example of their own higher enlightenment and co-operative movement within  themselves set to the world an example of better fraternity and brotherhood which alone can free men from the fear and dangers of moral and mental discord which leads to disaster for all.

He further says, that "You must remember that life will have for you many disappointments. If one-fifth of one’s hopes are realized, one is extremely lucky and fortunate, so do not be discouraged by disappointments. Failures should be forgotten and new efforts made. Despondency is a sin, and hope, a necessary part of faith both for material wealth and, above all, for progress to spiritual enlightenment.”

Furthermore he made it clear that “Struggle is the meaning of life. Defeat or victory is in the hands of God, but struggle itself is man’s duty and should be his joy.”

I am extremely fortunate and thankful to the creators of Kiva for extending   an   opportunity to my family and me to be a part of such a magnificent fraternity through whom we can participate in extending our help to others in need to fulfill their vision or dream.
lenders.occupational_info:
I have been an entrepreneur  in Dallas Texas for the past 40 years.

I have been blessed with a wonderful wife,three sons,two daughter in laws and four grandchildren.
